ingredients.content: 300 g bread rolls, slightly stale, cut in slices (1 cm)
½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
750 g beef (for stewing), cut in pieces (2-3 cm), patted dry with paper towels
350 g tinned chopped tomatoes or fresh
200 g peppers, red and green, cut in thin strips

preparations.content: Place bread rolls in mixing bowl and chop <b>12 sec/speed 6<b> with aid of spatula. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place parsley and onions in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add milk and warm <b>1 min 30 sec/60°C/speed 1<b>.
Add reserved breadcrumbs, eggs, salt, black pepper and nutmeg and mix <b>20 sec//speed 3<b> with aid of spatula. Transfer to a bowl and combine with spatula. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves, onions and oil in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Sauté <b>3 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.

Add sugar, tomato purée, chopped tomatoes, red wine, sweet paprika, salt, black pepper, caraway, lemon zest, marjoram, bay leaves, juniper berries and cloves and cook <b>40 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, lightly grease Varoma dish and tray. With wet hands, form 12 dumplings from the reserved dumpling mixture and place them in greased Varoma dish and Varoma tray.
Add 100 g water, place Varoma with dumplings into position and steam <b>20 min/Varoma//speed 1<b>. Set Varoma aside.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh flour and 50 g water into it. Mix flour and water.
Add flour-water mixture, 150 g water and peppers to mixing bowl, place Varoma back into position and cook <b>8 min/90°C//speed 1<b>. Season goulash to taste and serve hot with dumplings.
